Reviews.Title: “Flash decor, poor service, rip-off breakfast”
Reviews.Author: laurenitalia
Reviews.Content: The design is wonderful and we gasped at our striking mirrored room; however we gasped again when the pretty concierge who showed us there looked down at the wet towel left on the bathroom floor, didn't mention it, and left the room, leaving us to deal with it. The staff here smile a lot but ignore any problems. Going down to breakfast we waited in the dining room/bar for five minutes as a group of managers talked near us, pointedly wouldn't meet our eyes and then yelled over their shoulders for a waitress to come. Breakfast was 25 euros for just a Continental which doesn't even include fresh juice (4-5 euros extra)! Concierge, when asked to recommend out of the way exhibitions or concerts, looked blank and came up with the most obvious answers -the ones for which there were posters all over town. We asked him if anyone else were going to the airport and would share a water taxi with us; 'we don't do that', came the answer. We left our bags on the last day at checkout time, went for lunch, and when we came back to collect them I asked to use the toilet and was shown to the staff toilet - perhaps because I was no longer a guest? The high prices are only justified by the decor - the staff are all over the place. And LOTS of other boutique hotels in Venice are run better than this and charge less. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Designer / Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Brickland
Reviews.Content: This was great hotel with Phillip Starck signature design. Great location but once inside a little removed from the Venice vibe. We didn't have a room with a canal view but enjoyed the proximity to many sites. It was tricky to find. Its a short walk from Accademia or on the doorstep from S. Samuele stop.

Reviews.Title: “The most overpriced hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: STRUCTURE: Venetian-style small house adjacent to the museum Grassi, from this the hotel name. Hotel entrance tucked away on a quiet street, entrance insignificant, with no sign, no particular value. LOBBYING: attractive modern design with true and his own sculptures in glass and mirrors. Front nonexistent except for a small corner with a desk and the machine to load credit cards. ROOMS: small, I would say the smaller room where I have never stayed in a luxury hotel, the only bathroom with tub, separate shower did not. Safe located in the floor of the cabinet, I do not want to use it too much but you really had to sit in the chamber floor. Panorama nonexistent, choking, the window was a blank wall in front of no more than a meter away. Virtually no one saw the light of heaven. Modern furniture almost completely mirrors. Courtesy bathroom does not exist, only the rechargeable dispenser three star hotel. No hotel has rooms overlooking the canal. RESTAURANT: excellent, good modern design, comfortable, good quality of each course, friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere. SWIMMING: non-existent. OVERALL: overprice so as to make me want to change hotels immediately after check-in. I strongly recommend to stay for the usual price of the hotel Danieli or Cipriani.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay184
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Can't complain about a thing. The whole hotel is beautifully design and the lobby is trendy and a great place to relax and have a drink. Rooms are again well designed, beautiful, everything you need. Service is excellent (we got a free upgrade while there, spent some time chatting with the lobby bartenders - all was great!). Its a little bit of a walk to the main sights, but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Ian Schraeger comes to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kyminasia
Reviews.Content: OK, even if he didn't design this hotel, he should have. I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend before Christmas and we loved it. Very chic and contemporary, central location (once you know how to find it), nice rooms. We were very content here and would stay again. Just two things to note: breakfast is crazy expensive at 40 euros and no a la carte menu. I just wanted coffee and fruit and that meant leaving the hotel every morning if I didn't want to spend 40 euros for it. Also, the lobby level can turn into a raging "party" late at night - both nights we were there, there were parties, one hosted by Venice Magazine. Coming home from dinner was like entering a nightclub. Our room was only one floor up, so had we not been willing to join the party or had sleeping pills, there would have been no possibility of sleeping at this hotel. Had we been determined and unable to sleep in our trendy room it would have ruined the weekend. Ask about their party plans or at least try to get on a high floor if you might want to go to sleep before 2-4am.

Reviews.Title: “Desappointing”
Reviews.Author: kbh1971
Reviews.Content: Nice design. However, you would expert from a 5 star Hotel(400 euro/night) a perfect service which was not The case: Small room, dark Clothes are not arranged Breakfast (not included in The price) outrageously priced (40 euro) There are plenty of luxury hotels in Venice much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Venice all over again”
Reviews.Author: lenaDubai
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Venice anytime soon and I suggest you do. Then go out of season and a stay here and you won't be disappointed. While not overlooking the grand canal (most rooms anyway) it is super close and within a very realistic walking distance of everything, there is even a water taxi station almost directly outside. The rooms are small, but this is Venice not Vegas but impeccably furnished with Philippe Starck touches throughout all rooms. The restaurant is casual and has an exception feature of serving you breakfast when YOU want not when it suits them! We didn't visit the VIP room but suggest if you get a chance you do.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: Noble-Clarke
Reviews.Content: I took my husband for a surprise birthday weekend. We began by arriving on the hotel's vintage water taxi through the mist to our hotel and were shown to our room - all very slick but perhaps not entirely worth the E140 price tag. My major disappointment was the room itself, we paid almost Â£700 for 2 nights in a superior (standard) room, which was very small with only a shower room and a very overpowering smell of air freshener, which actually gave me headaches for our whole stay. Considering the price I was also surprised breakfast wasn't included. We had a great meal in the hotel restaurant on our first night and they recommended a fantastic local place for the next night. We also went to the Krug lounge for a glass of Krug, which feels very exclusive. And although we had to pay for them, the breakfasts were superb. Overall we had an amazing time in Venice but I didn't feel the room justified the price (even in Venice). Would I go back? Only if they had a deal on.

Reviews.Title: “Reflections in the many mirrors”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early October and overall were impressed by the hotel, the reviews by 'theinspectorcalls' and Upintheair23' are accurate. The hotel has one large reception that serves as a bar, lounge and restaurant, while the roof terrace is delightful for breakfast it is only as good as the weather. The lack of storage space, no bathrobes and no complimentary water beyond the first night were the downsides, for the room rate and pitch of the hotel these omissions should be addressed. What made our visit so memorable was meeting Luigi the head chef on our first night. A delightful dinner later, we arranged to meet him the following morning to buy fish. An informative visit to Jean-Paulo the 68 year old fishmonger, lengthly negotiations and a few coffees later we were set up for supper that evening. That evening we sat alongside Luigi and his delightful team while they prepared and cooked exquisite seafood dishes that had been customized for our taste. In Luigi, the hotel has a true jewel, whose international experience, warm personality and culinary skills will make us journey back. This hotel is special, tucked away in a quiet corner, yet as always in this life it is the people that truly make the difference. Thank you Paul and Kerry Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is a winner”
Reviews.Author: theinspectorcalls
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is an absolute winner, beautiful and served at any time of the day and in any location in the hotel. Superb. I just wish more small hotels would follow suit. The hotel is located up an alley about 50 meters from the canal. Nicely tucked away from the crowds. The picture on their web site had us believing the hotel was situated on the canal itself â€“ itâ€™s not! Nice roof garden to sit and sunbathe and have breakfast on. Excellent food, service on the whole good but some of the staff can appear moody. Our exec room was smaller than we expected and as with the rest of the hotel brimming with mirrors. Itâ€™s a good experience staying here especially if you like exotic glass decorations. Maybe a little more thought could go into the practicalities of actually staying in a room for a few days â€“ like drawers would be handy â€¦

Reviews.Title: “completely blown away”
Reviews.Author: UpInTheAir23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzina Grassi in April for my birthday weekend. This hotel is absolutely amazing! We were completely blown away from the minute we walked in to check-out. It's very chic and modern... the rooms have a ton of mirrors and cool furniture. We stayed in executive rooms -- ask for one with a private terrace. The bar and restaurant are very swanky... a great spot to take a break from siteseeing for some drinks. It never seemed to get crowded in the bar at all which was nice... we felt like we had the place to ourselves at times. They also have a terrace on the second floor where you can have breakfast served to you! The hotel is located in a nice, quiet alley away from all of the crowds of tourists... but a very short walk to everything. The staff is outstanding. They booked our gondola ride for us and then walked us to the dock. I didn't tell the hotel it was my birthday but they must have noticed when I presented my passport at check-in... they surprised me with a birthday cake delivered to my room. The level of customer service at this hotel was like nothing I have ever seen... and I'm an event planner, so my attention to detail and expectations are definitely on the high end. I feel like this hotel made our trip to Venice. I can't wait to go back and I will definitely stay at the Palazzina Grassi when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Total and Absolute Glamour and Style!”
Reviews.Author: TheLavishOne1
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel and the staff are amazing! Nothing was too difficult to arrange, breakfast and all meals superb, romantic cruises and excursions. First class and didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between brilliant and awesome...”
Reviews.Author: alltonnee
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel. I often find that 'it hotels' generate such high expectation that it's almost impossible for them to live up to, but Palazzina Grassi is in a league of its own. It manages to be luxurious but 'homely', extremely stylish but with an air of understated discretion and surprisingly lacking unnecessary pretension. My room was ample in size with plenty of room for luggage. It certainly 'wowed' on entry. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room silent. With a large indulgent bathroom, the room was an oasis of style and tranquility in a beautiful city. Unfortunately I only stayed for one night, but I would return without hesitation. In a city possibly lacking some contemporary style, Palazzina Grassi is a beacon of modern brilliance combining old and new... a true hotel 'experience' that one doesn't come across particularly often.

Reviews.Title: “Fountain of positive emotions”
Reviews.Author: rodi3
Reviews.Content: I was to Pallazina last weekend, spent my business trip there, making shooting of a Chef. Itâ€™s difficult to describe my impressions as itâ€™s absolutely unforgettable. The hotel is located in a very hart of the city, so you have access to all main places and Canal Grande. The mix and combinations of modern art, antiques and unique pieces makes you feel very special. The staff is very welcome! After checking in, I was invited for a lunch. The dining area with show kitchen, where the chefâ€™s staff prepares the finest dishes. During making shooting i tried culinary masterpiece, created by Chief of Palazzina. Even if you are staying in Venice just some hours, you should go there and taste these fantastic meals! That is surprising place where you can feel the fountain of positive emotions and home spirit everywhere in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best...from a seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: JDW07
Reviews.Content: I dont usually write reviews, but the negative comments I saw on this hotel compelled me to contribute. The Palazzina Grassi is an incredible hotel, so long as you know what you are after and in for. It isnt one of Venice's grand old hotels, but thrives on its uniqueness. The hotel pickup from the airport was fantastic, prompt and easy and we had an impromtu tour of Venice en ruite to the hotel. Arriving we were ushered into the central restaurant/coffee area for complimentary coffee while they checked us in which was painless and efficient. The room is spacious, beatifully decorated and incredibly welcoming. Yes, there is a shortage of storage space, but for a weekend trip it is perfect. Mirrors and lighting creates an ambient atmosphere. The location is terrific, at first it will seem like you are in a quiet area and will never find the hotel again, but you will soon discover how close you are to all the main attractions and still have a bit of a respite from the masses of tourists. The staff at the hotel were some of the best I've encountered - nothing was too much trouble and reservations were made easily and painlessly. Overall, I would stay there again every time I go back to Venice - especially as we went to one of the more traditional 5 star hotels for lunch and it looked tired and stale. Wherever your travels make take you, make the most of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AAMarwan
Reviews.Content: Small Rooms. Way to overpriced. Virtaully no closet space. Air Conditioning didnt work. TV had a constant buzzing sound, and when asked, Staff said that was normal in all rooms . Front office staff very confused and lied about facilities. Sheets had a grungy odor. Location very far from heart of Venice.The service and amenities at the restaurant were hideous. The bread was hard and was obviously old. No place mats. One waiter coudnt understand a word we said when asking for water. All this under the umbrella of "Philip Stark", what a waste.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning!!”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 21-23 August 2010, Superior room #113. Certainly one of the most beautiful hotel I have experienced. Absolutely amazing. Wow factor as soon as entering the hotel! Philip Starck design in an excellent mix with traditional Venetian atmosphere. Colors are rich and warm. The beautiful Venetian (Murano) chandeliers are spectacular. Fantastic mirrors in all sizes everywhere. Furniture, decoration, glass sculptures, vintage objects â€“ all items are so thought through. And yet, it is extremely cozy and welcoming. The Krug lounge is special with its furniture and dÃ©cor combined with great views over the Grand Canal. The terrace on the second floor is charming. Although no great views, itâ€™s a relaxing place to sit down at with a glass of spumanti or having your breakfast in the morning. Talking about breakfast, another great invention to serve â€œat any time or place of the hotelâ€�! Walking the way to our room was a delight. The hallways are wonderfully decorated with large framed pictures standing off the walls, art pieces and grand backlit Venetian mirrors along the walk. Stunning! Our room (which â€œlowestâ€� category) was of very good size with a large bathroom. Obviously the dÃ©cor and design in line with what we had already experienced. Large backlit mirrors, warm dimmer controlled room lightning, design furniture and a modern bathroom in natural stone. TV is hidden in the mirror in front of the bed. IPOD plug next to the bed with ceiling speakers in room and bathroom. Bed was ultra comfortable. Although no views, which a pity, however only believe there are some suites with Grand Canal view. Personalized service with a very attentive and polite staff. Easy check-in over a welcoming glass of prosecco or cup of coffee. Breakfast was basically anything you could wish for. A perfect location. There is a gondola service taking you over to the other side of the canal, which is very convenient. Hotel price fairly good for Venice, although everything consumed in the hotel is expensive! There is no personal on the terrace so think they should have a telephone enabling customers to make orders from the bar or restaurant. But all in all: a terrific experience and would be a pleasure to stay at the Palazzina Grassi again!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - but with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: LoveGrandHotels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night pre-cruise in August 2010. The property itself is gorgeous, although would be a bit too Philippe Starck for those not familiar with his incredibly contemporary and chic designs. In other words, I liked it, but my elderly parents would not for sure. Absolutely great arrival service. Welcomed to the lobby bar for canapÃ©s from the chef and a welcome drink of our choosing. Very nice and relaxing! Check in is done in the bar seated 1-on-1. No traditional front desk here. Location is excellent, right on the Grand Canal but far enough away from the touristic chaos that is so much a part of Venice these days. [BTW, a little off topic, but Iâ€™m through with going to Venice. Been there a few times now and itâ€™s SO touristy and SO SO off the charts expensive that I might as well go to Italy in Epcot and have a better time. Everyone should see the place once, but the prices are so insane for everything, from shopping to food to even a 17 Euro bottle of beer! Simply outrageous! The whole town was a bit of a letdown after a couple of prior visits.] Back to the hotel now. We occupied the cheapest room, and being new, it was very nice. The room itself was small (Iâ€™d say about 130 sq feet or so), and the bathroom was just about as big as that Iâ€™d say. So all in all it was comfortable for a 1 night stay. Now the bad partâ€¦ as other reviewers have mentioned, the electronics in the rooms are a nightmare. Lights went on and off without doing anything. This was a MAJOR pain in the neck. I could deal with it, but older/less sophisticated travelers would be extremely frustrated with all of the inoperative modernization. When you told the staff about it, they acted surprised and said theyâ€™d look into itâ€¦ all the while knowing Iâ€™m sure that there are issues since many of the reviews here already point this problem out. The air conditioning temp could not be controlled from the room. You had to call downstairs to have them adjust it for you via their â€œcomputerâ€� so I was told. The shower door was improperly installed and will break sooner than later if not corrected. One good slam shut and there will be glass everywhere (yes, I reported this to the staff). And I did not care for the bathroom infinity sink. Nice to look at but water splashed everywhere on the countertop, walls etc. The mirror was also not positioned directly above the sink so it made shaving and some other tasks a small challenge. As for food, only had the welcome canapÃ©s (excellent) and breakfast in the morning (included in the rate and very tasty and deluxe â€“ if not in your rate, itâ€™s 38 Euros per person!). Late night bar service was good â€“ but again those prices, 30 Euros for 4 beers (but better than the aforementioned 17 Euro per bottle price that youâ€™ll find near San Marco square). Now here is a weird thing. We stayed on a Friday night in mid-August, the height of the tourist season. There were far more staff working than hotel guests. Iâ€™d say only about 4 rooms were booked from a comment I overheard from a hotel staffer. The place was eerily quiet. Would I say here againâ€¦ probably not unless there was a great rate/offer and the tripadvisor reviews steadily improve.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: foodie0075
Reviews.Content: The Palazzina Grassi was quite a disappointment to us. We were looking forward to staying in a new, hip hotel in Venice. We stayed for three nights. While the design is attractive, we had multiple problems with the hotel. We had to change rooms twice, because the lights were not functioning properly. We also found the staff to have surprisingly limited knowledge of the city, in terms of restaurants and tourist attractions. For example, they could not even tell us where a nearby ATM would be located.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: autolink
Reviews.Content: great room, excellent staff. Very good restaurant. I have stayed at the Gritti, and the Danieli, and I liked this hotel the most! This is a small, fresh, and quiet luxury hotel. You feel at home here with everyone attending to your needs. I would go back to The Pallazina Grassi in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “FORM OVER SUBSTANCE”
Reviews.Author: JimboBerlin
Reviews.Content: I can appreciate that good design can be something of an achievement in itself but I wonder if it's sufficient to rely on the aesthetics of a hotel to replace the management that it is in absolute dire need of having. If you picture a beautiful ship sailing the high seas in a storm with no one acting as its skipper at the helm nor its captain tending to the rudder you get the feeling of what the recently opened Palazzo Grassi Hotel in Venice is all about. The hotel boasts that this is Philippe Stark's first hotel in Italy and for that they should be proud but the glamour and excitement quickly ends there when the foibles appear everywhere and when the boat quickly takes on water. Our fun begins soon after check-in where we try to turn on the lights of the room. To the left of the door is a consol of light switches that after 6 days I did not seem to quite master but which apparently turn off and on the lights in a myriad of options. Find me a simple on-off switch or a dimmer switch and I'm a happy person - perhaps I'm old fashioned but hey it's designed by Stark. Then to add to the mystery while working in the room in the afternoon the lights suddenly come on and the room is fully lit in the mid afternoon sun with no one in the room having touched any of the many light switches. Five minutes later they all turn off again without any effort or intent on its guests, namely us. We search for the safe but it is not working so we take out and reinsert its batteries hoping that it will now allow us to enter a new code so that we can put our valuables away and we continue to have a non-working safe so we make due. When the sun falls we are eager to get to sleep having roamed around the beautiful and mystical streets of Venice. The sheets are quite hard seemingly made of linen and not soft cotton that is commonly associated with the high thread counts of better sheets. The sheet under our bodies is not a typical fitted sheet that hugs the bed mattress but instead a flat sheet that is folded by hand around the edges of the bed. Naturally, when one moves around at night this flat sheet moves with you forming creases and wrinkles that begin to feel uncomfortable under your body as you lay down trying to sleep. Why in the world did they go for two flat sheets as opposed to one fitted sheet and one flat sheet is beyond me - perhaps this is another suggestion by Stark. Call me traditional but when it comes time to sleep I am looking for a dark room that is quiet so that I can relax - not here though; at this hotel the smoke detector is directly above the bed and blinks incessantly in the night as I try to shut my eyes and sleep. Add to this another smoke detector at the front door of the room and you soon have what appears to be a small discotech of pulsating lights in your private suite. We are offered two types of pillows, one made of foam and the other made of what appears to be a combination of feathers and other materials both of which are very high and both of which essentially wrench my neck upwards so as to make a comfortable sleep difficult. I bring this to the attention of the staff who agree that it is an important issue and yet who do nothing to resolve the problem. The fun continues... In the morning we are tripping over our clothing for the Stark design apparently called for a stark interior devoid of any usable shelving to make the simple task of putting ones clothes away to be a challenge. I suppose this is another design issue that the hotel was challenged with in having to accommodate Mr Starck's designs, however in practice I think that most guests would appreciate ample storage room to put their clothing away so as not to trip over them. The temperature in the room is set at a minimum of 25C (77F) a tad too hot for me as I prefer a cooler temperature when it comes time to sleep. However, I am not permitted to reduce the temperature below 25C as the setting of the thermostat does not allow this. It seems that this is no place for customer preferences to prevail. Add to this the fact that the fan in the room does not work and that the air becomes stale and does not feel like it is circulating and you soon have a very uncomfortable room. Since my complaints about the pillows and flickering lights were ignored I lose hope that any other issues that I bring to the staff's attention will receive any serious attention. We head downstairs in the morning for breakfast and we order what we like from the menu, which is a nice treat. We watch the stressed out restaurant staff endeavour to cope with the trickle of orders coming from a room that is not quite 25% full. My partner's scrambled eggs arrive and I get to watch her eat them as I wait another 15 minutes for my omelet to materialize. It seems that the staff here are either unaware or do not care that we eat together at the same time and this is not an isolated event for it happened almost every morning that we ate at the hotel. On one particular morning, again when the restaurant was almost empty, my omelet arrived with toast as ordered and there was no sign anywhere of my bacon. About 25 minutes later, when my omelet was long gone the waitress presented me with a small plate of bacon, which I requested to be returned. She looked at me with a puzzled gaze not quite understanding why I might no longer want it, another sign of a complete lack of training or experience on the part of the wait staff. On one afternoon at approximately 2:30PM we return from our morning walk to find our room has still not been made despite the fact that we had been out of the room for hours. We are puzzled as there are not many quests in the hotel - what are these people doing we wonder. After a long day of touring we try to sleep again, the lights are flickering still, the pillows have cramped up our necks and now we hear our neighbours opening and closing their hotel room doors despite the fact that ours is firmly closed. What conclusions can we draw from these issues? It is clear that the hotel is crying out for an experienced manager to train and guide the eager staff who sincerely try hard but who are desperately lacking the skills and training necessary to offer five star service. We ask for the manager and we are told that he only spends 20% of his time there and 80% of his time elsewhere! We are aghast - we wonder how they can expect to survive with no hands-on dedicated manager and with a crew of inexperienced staff - we pay our substantially expensive bill and we depart reflecting upon the experiences we have had and the ultimate insult of having a staff member skip the queue and steal our water taxi on a night when we were certainly in a hurry to make a social engagement - we vow never to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler3
Reviews.Content: I love staying in brand new hotels, and was fortunate enough to be visiting Venice in time for the opening weekend of the Palazzina Grassi. It is conveniently located on the Grand Canal, just behind the Palazzo Grassi. To get there we took a water boat to the San Samuele stop and it's just a few minutes walk. It's also on a vaporetto stop (we used the 2 line to the train station when leaving). The hotel is small (26 rooms) and gorgeous. The Phillipe Starck designed rooms and the Murano glass is beyond impressive. We stayed in a queen room on the first floor, and was more than enough room for us. The bathroom was gorgeous-- nice rain shower and I especially loved the infinity sink (mostly for the looks of it-- a bit of splash back when washing my face). The bed had the highest threat-count sheets I've ever slept in and was amazingly comfortable. Mirrors everywhere in the bedroom. Seriously. All four walls and on the wardrobe. The staff was extremely pleasant and made sure our stay was enjoyable. There were tiny opening-weekend type hiccups (a missing lightbulb in the bedroom, credit card machine a bit flaky), but definitely did not detract from the experience.
